title: Women’s Tour cycling opens with Northamptonshire stage - BBC News
summary: poland 's katarzyna niewiadoma wins stage one of the 2017 women 's tour through northamptonshire , on 7 june 2017 .
riders left daventry on the grand depart at 11:00 bst .
niewiadoma ( wm3 pro cycling ) crossed the line not long after 15:00 bst in kettering after opening up a strong lead .
marianne vos ( wm3 pro cycling ) comes in second , christine majerus ( boels dolmans ) in third .
`` i 'm so happy . it went so great today , '' says niewiadoma following her win .
riders faced categorised climbs at haselbech and rockingham , with sprints at desborough and oundle .
all of the world 's top 15 teams took part in the event .
stage two through stoke-on-trent and staffordshire takes place tomorrow , 8 june .
get involved : your view of the women 's tour # bbcwomenstour .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's it for our live coverage of the first stage of the women 's tour 2017 .
the northamptonshire leg is over but there 's still a long , long way to go for the competitors , starting with another 90 miles ( 144km ) tomorrow from stoke-on-trent .
you can of course scroll back here to see highlights from the day .
thanks for joining us .

documents.title: niewiadoma wins women 's tour opener
text: niewiadoma wins women 's tour opener

documents.title: a great day for northamptonshire 's barnes sisters
text: hannah and alice barnes from towcester put in impressive performances in their home county .
alice came seventh - the best-placed british rider - while hannah ( below ) finished fourteenth .
hannah said she enjoyed competing with her sister : `` i came round the last corner and thought i might get a jersey today .
then she came round and we started laughing .
`` it 's great having her in the race and to catch up as i do n't get to see her very often .
`` it was a good , challenging course today and seeing all the schoolkids out on the side of the road was really great .
`` but it 's a really long tour , so you have to really focus on doing the best you can while keeping something back for the following days . ''
their proud mum , sue barnes , said : `` it 's been great and it 's hard to get over that so many people really want to see them .
`` i do n't think they realise how famous they are among the cycling community . ''

documents.title: stoke-on-trent to host stage two tomorrow
text: we 'll bring you reaction from today 's race soon , but in the meantime let 's have a quick look ahead to tomorrow .
the 2017 women 's tour will resume with stage two in stoke-on-trent .
it 'll be the second time the event has been to the city , which will host both the start and finish of the race .
in 2016 , marianne vos ( ned ) - who finished second in the general classification today - won the staffordshire stage of the race .

documents.title: alice barnes claims best british rider jersey
text: twenty-one-year-old alice barnes ( below ) from towcester in northamptonshire was the top british rider in stage one - finishing seventh overall in the daventry to kettering race .
her prize for doing so is the best british rider jersey , which is awarded to the leading british rider on general classification following each day 's stage .
her sister , hannah , won the overall best british rider jersey in the 2015 edition of the race .
keep it in the family , girls
author: Jonathan Park
BBC Look East sport

text: poland 's katarzyna niewiadoma leads stage one of the women 's tour with just 20km of today 's race remaining , but the gap is narrowing .
if she can maintain her advantage , the 22-year-old , riding for wm3 , will claim her first victory of 2017 .
last year , niewiadoma finished sixth in the rio 2016 women 's olympic road race .

documents.title: kettering ready to host stage finish
text: this is the scene at the finish line in kettering .
the market town in the north of northamptonshire is the most visited of any town in the history in the women 's tour ; it 's hosting a stage finish for a third time .
whether or not we get a sprint to the line is another matter - with poland 's katarzyna niewiadom now over three minutes ahead and on course for her first victory of 2017 .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: rockingham prepares for the tour
text: the scene is set in rockingham for the second queen of the mountains stage on the northamptonshire route .
this small , village near corby , right on the northerly edge of the county , is built along a hill .
having just walked it , i can confirm it is rather steep !
it 's just over half a mile long ( 0.92km ) and involves a climb of 210ft ( 64m ) .
once the riders reach the top , passing rockingham castle , they 'll be on the outskirts of corby .
they 'll then pass through the town centre , on to weldon and then back out into the countryside towards oundle .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: dissecting the peloton
text: if you have n't been to see a top cycling event before , you might be a little surprised to see the movable convoy that the race brings with it .
in front of the 99 cyclists are vehicles carrying organisers , judges , media and police .
they 're followed by team support vans , tv crews , race doctors and just about everything else you could imagine .

documents.title: stage one in profile
text: so , we 're up and running in the first stage of the 2017 women 's tour .

as the riders head out of long buckby , the next obstacle will be the first queen of the mountains stage at haselbech the title is given to the best climber in the race , with a second long climb at rockingham hill later .
there are also sprint stages for the fastest riders at desborough and oundle .
the race will finish in kettering , with the earliest estimated time being 14:44 .

text: this was the scene as the riders headed out of daventry

documents.title: racing for real
text: the peloton ( cycling speak for the main field or group of cyclists in a race ) are out of daventry and into long buckby - which means the real race is just beginning .
the first 9.7km are known as a `` neutral zone '' where the field stick together , but from here on it is a straight race to the finish in kettering .
km0 : we 've reached long buckby , which means that the flag is dropped and we are racing !
kettering is just 147.5km away !
# ovowt

documents.title: women 's tour stage one : riders to watch
text: almost all of the big names from the world of women 's cycling are taking part in this year 's women 's tour .
the line-up includes 2014 winner marianne vos , 2015 champion lisa brennauer and last year 's victor , lizzie deignan of great britain .
rio 2016 women 's road race olympic champion , anna van der breggen , is also taking part , with all of the world 's top 15 teams involved .
of local interest will be the fortunes of sisters hannah and alice barnes , who both grew up in towcester .

documents.title: thousands of spectators expected to line route through northamptonshire
text: northamptonshire has played a big role in the women 's tour since it started in 2014 , and this year the whole race gets under way in daventry .

some of the world 's top riders will set off from the burton memorial in the high street at 11:00 , completing a relatively sedate circuit out of the town centre and back again , before setting off on their way to kettering where the first stage will end .
thousands of spectators are expected along the route , especially at the queen of the mountains sections in haselbech and rockingham and the sprints in desborough and oundle .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: women 's tour : road closures
text: there will be some disruption on roads across northamptonshire as the women 's tour makes its way around the county .
the most notable closures will be in daventry - where the event begins at 11:00 - and in kettering , where it ends .
daventry
kettering
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: a big day of international sport in the county
text: this is the fourth women 's tour and the fourth time it 's been in northamptonshire .
ever since the first race began in oundle in 2014 , it 's established itself as a big day of international sport in the county , drawing many of the world 's top women cyclists to the county .
it 's also a chance to show off the delights of northamptonshire to the wider world - the rolling countryside as well as the towns such as kettering and daventry .
and once again , hannah barnes and her sister alice carry hopes of a local northamptonshire winner .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: riders now target women 's tour - deignan
text: riders now target women 's tour - deignan

documents.title: women 's tour : the route in full
text: after the opening day in northamptonshire , the women 's tour also includes stages in warwickshire , staffordshire and derbyshire , before the final leg in london on 11 june .
this year 's route will combine testing climbs and beautiful scenery in the heart of england with the london finish , which will be an undoubted highlight of the sporting calendar . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: women 's tour : the northamptonshire leg
text: stage one is is 91.7-mile ( 148km ) route from daventry - which will host the start for the first time - to kettering , where the race will finish for its third consecutive year .
if you fancy heading along to watch , the tour will leave the high street in daventry at 11:00 but the race will properly start on bridge road in long buckby .

the riders will then take in towns and villages including west haddon , desborough , rothwell , cottingham , rockingham , corby , oundle , thrapston and finedon , before ending on sheep street in kettering from about 15:00 .
here 's a rough map below , or you can get a more detailed map here .
notable events on the route include hills at rockingham ( below ) and haselbech , and sprints at desborough and oundle .
estimated times :
11:00 : daventry , high street ( tour start )
11:15 : long buckby ( race officially starts )
11:36 : haselbech ( hill )
12:27 : desborough ( sprint )
12:55 : rockingham ( hill )
13:32 : oundle ( sprint )
14:44 : kettering , sheep street ( finish )
you can find a full list of estimated timings for the northamptonshire route here .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: women 's tour 2017
text: the women 's tour 2017 , begins this morning in northamptonshire .
stage one of the five-day cycling race is a 91.7-mile ( 148km ) route from daventry high street to sheep street in kettering .
all of the world 's top 15 teams will take part in the event , which is a part of the uci women 's worldtour .
lizzie armitstead ( in yellow ) won the event for the first time last year when the final stage was northampton to kettering .
the 27-year-old briton , riding for the boels dolmans team , finished in the pack to preserve her 11-second lead on south africa 's ashleigh moolman-pasio .
women 's tour 2016 : general classification
lizzie armitstead ( gbr/boels dolmans ) 16hrs 0mins 39secs
ashleigh moolman-pasio ( sa/cervelo bigla ) +11secs
elisa longo borghini ( ita/wiggle high5 ) +13secs
marianne vos ( ned/raboliv ) +18secs
amanda spratt ( aus/orica ais ) +20secs
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News
